isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - INSPECT - INSPECTION RECOMMENDATIONS AND INTERVALS

svcprocinfo.para: Prior to performing inspections, the following preliminary steps should be accomplished:

item.para: Set parking brake and block drive wheels to prevent vehicle movement.
Jack vehicle until steering axle wheels are raised from the ground. Support raised vehicle with safety stands.

warning.para: Never work under a vehicle supported only by a jack.

svcsubproc.title: General Recommendations
svcsubproc.para: Intervals of inspection or service are recommended for general or average vehicle use. It may be appropriate to increase frequency of intervals depending on vehicle service.

svcsubproc.title: General Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Perform a thorough visual inspection for proper assembly, broken parts, and looseness each time the vehicle is lubricated. Make certain spring to axle beam mounting nuts and steering connection fasteners are secure.

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Alignment
svcsubproc.para: Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on intervals of inspecting wheel alignment. However, if excessive steering effort, vehicle wander or uneven and excessive tire wear is evident, then check wheel alignment. Refer to WHEEL ALIGNMENT INSPECTION.

svcsubproc.title: Steering Axle Stops
svcsubproc.para: No specific interval is recommended. However, if steering turning radius is insufficient or excessive, adjust stops. Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Tie Rod Ends
svcsubproc.para: Inspect each time axle is lubricated. Check for seal damage, worn ball socket or loose fasteners.

svcsubproc.title: Knuckle Thrust Bearings
svcsubproc.para: Adjust knuckle vertical play each time knuckle pin is removed for service, at axle overhaul or when excessive knuckle vertical movement is noted.

svcsubproc.title: Knuckle Pins
svcsubproc.para: Inspect pin fit in bushings when pin is removed for service, at axle overhaul or when looseness is noted.

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Bearings and Knuckle Thrust Bearings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect wheel and knuckle thrust bearings for damage or wear each time hub/drum is removed or steering knuckle repaired.
